FuncDef:
The sdh-alarm nni-ais lrdi enable command enables a CPOS interface to send AIS bit streams to a network-side device when an LRDI alarm is detected on the interface.
The undo sdh-alarm nni-ais lrdi enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, a CPOS interface is not enabled to send AIS bit streams to a network-side device when an LRDI alarm is detected on the interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In unstructured data transfer for CES scenarios (SAToP), to enable a local AC-side CPOS interface to notify a network-side device of TX fiber faults on the interface, run the sdh-alarm nni-ais lrdi enable command to enable the CPOS interface to send AIS bit streams to the network-side device when an LRDI alarm is detected on the interface. The fault information can then be quickly and transparently transmitted to the network-side device.
Precautions
This command is supported only on CR5D00C4CF70, CR5D00C8CF71, CR5D00C2CF70,CR5D00C8CF72,CR5D00C2CF71 subcards.
When a CPOS interface has been added to a aps-group, this function cannot be configured. When the using vc4 command is run on a CPOS interface, this function is not supported.
